Bag O' Links - 2/8/2009 Elad Meidar

02 Aug 2009

  • Git workflow for Rails developers – i hope that the day i won’t feel that i am underusing Git will come soon.
  • Merchant Account – a new merchant service provider.
  • Optimizing sub queries and joins in MySQL – a good read.
  • Model based subdomain routes – neat, not sure it’s the right place to solve the problem, but whatever.
  • …and simply subdomain-ing in rails – same clever response.

GitHub Treasures

  • Migratory – Rails migration extender for default values and adding indexes. (Note: you can also checkout (clone, hehe) Mike Gunderloy’s model-plus)
  • Twiio – A Twiio wrapper API. (voice control).
  • Lunching-Soon – on a closed beta? this might be what you need.
  • ecproxy – ecproxy is a CMS for building e-commerce sites that act as a proxy purchaser. It is aimed for introducing overseas items.
  • SalonSpace – Rails application for hair dressers (salon?), don’t ask why i need it, i just do.
  • HIrb – A mini view framework for console/irb that’s easy to use, even while under its influence. Console goodies include a no-wrap table, auto-pager, tree and menu.
  • JS.Desk – JS.Desk wants deep down to be a rich UI and Application framework for JavaScript.
